string-array.name: biology_example_array
string-array.item: Photosynthesis
process by which plants use the sun\'s energy to convert water and carbon dioxide into sugars
Reactant
a chemical substance that is present at the start of a chemical reaction
Product
a chemical substance formed as a result of a chemical reaction
Chloroplast
an organelle found in plant and algae cells where photosynthesis occurs
Stomata
Pore-like openings in leaves that allow gases (CO2 and O2) and water to diffuse in and out of the leaves.
Guard Cells
cells that control the opening and closing of stomata
Chlorophyll
green pigment in plants that absorbs light energy used to carry out photosynthesis
ATP
main energy source that cells use for most of their work
ADP
adenosine diphosphate; molecule that ATP becomes when it gives up one of its three phosphate groups

resources.string: There are only 3 main sections of this app:
This is the first screen you see when you enter the app. You can add a new deck of cards, or edit/delete existing decks by tap and holding a deck until new options appear.
You can view all the cards in a deck individually or as a list. This is where you can add/edit/delete cards within a deck.
Test your knowledge by quizzing yourself on the cards! You will get quiz results and view the cards you answered incorrectly after the quiz.

You can export decks as a CSV (comma separated values) file, which you can open up in any text editor such as notepad. You can also import any comma separated value file, which you can make in any text editor. Just have values you want for the front and back of each card on a single row, separated by a comma.

For example, a file consisting of the following would be acceptable:

"Date Google was founded, Sept 4 1998
Number of bones in the human body, 206
Planet closest to the sun, Mercury"
